Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether a refugee claim can be reconsidered and vacated due to misrepresentation and if the applicant is entitled to a new hearing
Crimes.Outcome: Application for judicial review dismissed; no new hearing granted
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of CRDD's decision dismissing motion for a hearing after vacating refugee status
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: No credible evidence remained to support the applicants' claims
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Refugee protection based on fear of persecution
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Assessment of credibility and consistency in refugee claims
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Misrepresentation and contradictions in the applicants' claims
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Reconsideration and vacating of refugee determination
Crimes.Application_Error: Material misrepresentation in the refugee claim
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Presence of fraudulent means or misrepresentation in obtaining refugee status
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Standard for vacating a refugee determination under s. 69.2(2)
Crimes.Application_Factor: Inconsistencies and false statements in testimony
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Refugee status vacated; no entitlement to new hearing
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Proper application of s. 69.2(2) in vacating refugee status
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of credible supporting evidence post-reconsideration
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Applicants had opportunity to respond but failed to provide credible rebuttal
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to the CRDD’s dismissal of motion for a new hearing
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Eligibility for a new hearing after vacatur of refugee status
Crimes.Omission_Type: Deliberate omission or distortion of material facts

Crimes.Crime_Name: Fraudulent means in obtaining refugee status
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether a refugee determination obtained by fraudulent means can be vacated under s. 69.2(2)
Crimes.Outcome: Application for judicial review dismissed; no certification of question due to lack of general importance
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of CRDD's dismissal of motion for hearing after vacating refugee status due to fraud
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: No credible evidence supported the applicants' claims after misrepresentation was established
Crimes.Legal_Provision: s. 69.2(2) and s. 69.3(4) of the Immigration Act
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Refugee protection based on fabricated or misrepresented facts
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Determination of fraud or misrepresentation using original claim record
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Applicants misrepresented facts, disqualifying them from further procedural rights
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Reconsideration and vacating of refugee determination based on fraud
Crimes.Application_Error: Submission of false information to obtain refugee status
Crimes.Review_Outcome: Judicial review dismissed; no question certified
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Use of fraudulent means in obtaining refugee determination
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Vacatur of refugee status under s. 69.2(2) and s. 69.3(4)
Crimes.Application_Factor: Material misrepresentations affecting the basis of the claim
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: CRDD properly dismissed motion; no new hearing required
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Validity of CRDD’s refusal to grant a new hearing after vacatur for fraud
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Obtaining refugee status through fraudulent means
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Reliance solely on original claim record for reconsideration
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process followed statutory requirements; no entitlement to additional hearings
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Fundamental lack of credibility due to misrepresentation
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that applicants should be granted a new hearing despite fraud
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Entitlement to procedural rights after vacatur for fraud
Crimes.Omission_Type: Active concealment or falsification of material facts
